page.title: 17TRANSPORT
page.content:
THE RAILWAY SERVICES
There are 2 railway lines passing through the area : the line from Strood to Maidstone and the line from Rochester to London. The lines were built in 1855 and were nationalized in 1948. The lines are administered by area operations manager,Mr.Hadley in Margate. STROOD TO MAIDSTONE LINE. About 25 goods trains a week use this line. There is a passenger service,on which the trains can hold 250 people,but most hold around 30. There are 3 periods of heavy use at rush hours. CHATHAM TO VICTORIA LINE. Only 1 goods train a day,and an empty coal train. The line is heavily used by passengers travelling from Medway (and beyond) to London (Victoria).
